etymology.description: 手(手) (shǒu, "hand") + 作(作) (zuò, "make"); 手作(手作) (shǒu zuò, "handmade") refers to items that are crafted by hand.
etymology.interpretation: The term 手作(手作) (shǒu zuò, "handmade") indicates that something is crafted manually rather than being mass-produced by machines. This conveys a sense of craftsmanship and the personal touch involved in the creation process.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢手作饰品(我喜歡手作飾品)。
这家店出售手作蛋糕(這家店出售手作蛋糕)，味道十分独特(味道十分獨特)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā diàn chūshòu shǒu zuò dàngāo, wèidào shífēn dú tè.
examples.english: This shop sells handmade cakes, and they taste very unique.
